why do systems work better than motivation for getting things done
<|assistant|>
Because motivation is a feeling and feelings are unreliable. You don't feel motivated at 6am or after a bad day, but a system doesn't care how you feel — it just runs. The people who actually ship things consistently aren't more motivated than everyone else, they've just made the decision in advance so they don't have to make it again every day.
<|user|>

<|assistant|>
You do need a spark to get started, sure. But the goal is to make the behavior automatic fast enough that motivation becomes irrelevant. Basically you're trying to trick your future lazy self before it can object. Works better than hoping you feel inspired.
topic: why creating systems works better than relying on motivation for self-improvement
